intro: Behen trachiatus, commonly known as the African violet, is a member of the Gesneriaceae family. It is native to tropical Africa and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 cm and thrives in humid, well-drained soil. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, white, and blue, making it a popular ornamental plant. It prefers indirect light and is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its adaptability and aesthetic appeal.
